response.overview: For millennia, humans have been harnessing microbes to produce everything from breads, to cheeses, to alcohol. Now these tiny organisms have produced another powerful revolution â€” the gene editing tool CRISPR. Rodolphe Barrangou, Ph.D., was working at the food company Danisco, where he was trying to produce yogurt lines resistant to contamination. In a series of groundbreaking experiments, he helped uncover what CRISPR was, how it worked, and why it could be so transformative.
response.title: The CRISPR Apostle: Rodolphe Barrangou
